=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Space Between Us [DVD]
Review Date: 2020/10/28
Store: Gary Oldman  (Actor),     Asa Butterfield  (Actor),     Peter Chelsom  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["Sixteen-year-old Gardner Elliot (Asa Butterfield) has lived his whole life with a team of scientists on Mars. He's always longed to see Earth to find the father he's never known and to meet a beautiful street-smart girl named Tulsa he's become friends with online. But when his chance finally comes, doctors discover his heart can't withstand the Earth's atmosphere. Eager to find his father, Gardner and Tulsa escape on a cross-country race against time to unravel the mysteries of how he came to be and where he belongs in the universe. Gary Oldman and Carla Gugino also star in this heartfelt and inspiring romantic adventure about how far one person can go for love.", 'Bonus Content:', 'Alternate Ending', 'Alternate Ending', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Love Featurette', 'Love Featurette', 'Feature Commentary with Director Peter Chelsom', 'Feature Commentary with Director Peter Chelsom', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.7

Review Text: What an suprising and original movie. The concept of being on a planet in space and not knowing how a body functions so differently than being on earth. I loved this story so much and would like to see more like it made.
Review Title: Different, Believable, and totally Entertaining
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
Shadowlands
Anthony Hopkins  (Actor),     Debra Winger  (Actor),     Richard Attenborough  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, HBO, All HBO Titles
['Amazon.com', 'This emotionally moving romantic drama was adapted by William Nicholson from his own acclaimed play, based upon the real-life romance (during the 1950s) between the British writer C.S. Lewis and a divorced American poet named Joy Gresham. Best known for writing', 'The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe', ", Lewis (Anthony Hopkins) is living comfortably as a respected Oxford don, his academic lifestyle a kind of shell protecting him from the emotional risk of love. Joy Gresham (Debra Winger) arrives at Oxford as an avid admirer of Lewis's writing, and the safety of his collegiate routine is quickly disrupted when Lewis realizes that he's fallen deeply and unexpectedly in love. Their courtship is uniquely engaging; he's shy and uncertain, she's outspoken and bold. But when Joy is diagnosed with cancer, Lewis's Christian faith is put to the test--he cannot fathom why their happiness together would be so drastically challenged. Together, they find a way to accept and honor the time they have shared together, and under the sensitive direction of Richard Attenborough,", 'Shadowlands', 'arrives at a conclusion that is both heartbreaking and uplifting at the same time. Hopkins and Winger are equally superb in this absorbing story of personal and spiritual transformation--a story previously filmed for British television in 1985, with Joss Ackland and Claire Bloom.', '--Jeff Shannon']
{'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Richard Attenborough', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Color, Dolby, DVD, Widescreen, NTSC, Letterboxed', 'Run time': '2 hours and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 13, 1999', 'Actors': 'Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Michael Denison, Andrew Seear, Tim McMullan', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 1.0), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Studio': 'Hbo Home Video', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I thought I  was purchasing the full version of the movie on DVD, but got an edited version. This was a disappointment to me because I  saw the fill version at the theater many years ago when it was released. I also had the full (unedited) version on VHS, but can not view it because have no VHS player to view it from anymore.
Wish I'd known it was edited  (shorter) version.

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Genre Preference:** Strong inclination towards emotionally impactful romantic dramas, particularly those based on real-life stories or literary figures, with an emerging interest in unique science fiction narratives that combine romance and adventure.

- **Media Format Preference:** Continues to favor DVD format for viewing movies, showing a consistent history of purchasing full versions over edited ones, reaffirming a strong preference for completeness in film experiences.

- **Emotional Engagement:** Values narratives that explore personal and spiritual themes, demonstrating a desire for content that not only entertains but also provokes thought and emotional reflection. This user appreciates original storytelling that offers fresh perspectives.

- **Critical Review Behavior:** Exhibits a discerning attitude in reviewing products, expressing satisfaction with imaginative plots and character development. Notable for appreciating unexpected and original concepts in films, indicating an openness to diverse narratives within their preferred genres.

- **Historical Interest:** Indicates appreciation for classic titles and legendary actors, suggesting a fondness for timeless storytelling and cinematic history while being receptive to modern films that provide innovative storytelling.

Overall, the user demonstrates a clear preference for quality, narrative depth, and emotional resonance in their media consumption choices, strongly favoring full, unedited versions of films, while embracing thought-provoking and entertaining unique stories.
